title: Certificate Error while opening the client.
body:
I keep getting this error when the game starts or ends and i'm not sure why.

"The certificate for the site your trying to reach does not match" or something like that anyone know why? It only happens when playing league.

replies.body: I've seen a few reports on this, and still trying to get more details on what's going on.  Can you provide a screenshot of the error?  The client uses IE for a lot of assets, so resetting your Internet Explorer to default could resolve this.  Additionally, I'm also curious what your [IE security setting](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202536660-Issues-with-the-League-of-Legends-Store-PvP-Net-#wq5) is set to.  Maybe a recent update auto-changed IE security settings, but I can't say for sure just yet.  Let me know if that helps!

Yes i can since i can basically cause it to happen everytime i log in

https://s17.postimg.org/jgzgceanz/Error.png

Also when i click on veiw certificate, it says it's from Bing and that it's for "Ensuring the identity of a remote computer" it only happens when using League though and iv tried adjusting my IE settings after searching it but it did not work

Thank you so much for that screenshot, it really helps a lot!  What happens if you do a complete IE reset, per[ these specific instructions](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/17441/windows-internet-explorer-change-reset-settings)?  Do it while logged out of the client, and try going back in after the changes are made.  I appreciate it!
It did not work unfortunately, i restarted my computer as well and still didn't work.

Thanks for the update!  To help rule out possibilities with IE as well as network settings, go over the [Login Issues ](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/NyheI8Xr-certificate-error-while-opening-the-client)guide when you have time.  Let me know what results you get, as this will help go a long way!
I don't believe it's related to any of those, and it's not as though it's a hindrance it's just something i thought i should report because Security Error's on League might be a problem.

I am also getting this issue while using a Mac running OS Sierra. This issue just recently appeared for me as well. 

Some more details, I run Chrome exclusively and rarely go to bing. I attempted to go to Bing using https to get a signed cert. This didn't fix the issue. It appears the cert is legitimate authorizing only Microsoft associated DNS names. Is there anything within the LoL client that links to bing or do you operate through their hosting for any content? For some reason the LoL client is requesting access to the bing.com cert, but LoL doesn't utilize any of the DNS names that are recognized by this cert. For reference here is a screen shot:

[screenshot](https://postimg.org/image/9c62nhhxh/)

I'm getting this same certificate error whenever I start my league. The problem started occurring after I clicked on the 'spectate' mode on OP.gg. Not sure if this is the exact cause, and the certificate is issued to www.bing.com for some reason. It is issued by Microsoft IT SSL SHA2. Help!
